questions.prompt: Scenario: You are designing a licensing server application. The software vendor issues a license file that is cryptographically locked to the MAC address of the host server. options.content: Create a Secondary ENI. Lock the license to the MAC address of this Secondary ENI. Attach it to the instance.

questions.prompt: Scenario: You have a web server instance in a public subnet. It currently has a Primary ENI with a Public IP. options.content: Secondary ENIs cannot have Public IPs.

questions.prompt: Scenario: You are running a containerized application on a single EC2 instance using Docker. You want each container to have its own dedicated IP address on the network so they can have distinct Security Groups. How can you achieve this using ENIs?

questions.prompt: Scenario: A junior admin accidentally detached the Secondary ENI from your production database instance while trying to troubleshoot. The application immediately stopped working.
